titleStmt.title: [Letter] 1796 Feb. 29, Philadelphia [to] Governor William Blount / J. Parkes : a machine readable transcription of an image
titleStmt.author: Parkes, J.

publicationStmt.publisher: University of Tennessee Special Collections Library

availability.p: This work is the property of the Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, TN. It may be used freely by individuals for research, teaching, and personal use as long as this statement of availability is included in the text. For all other use contact the Tennessee State Library and Archives, 403 Seventh Avenue North, Nashville, TN 37243-0312. (615) 741-2764.

bibl.title: [Letter] 1796 Feb. 29, Philadelphia [to] Governor William Blount / J. Parkes
bibl.author: Parkes, J.
bibl.note: This document is a letter to Governor William Blount from J. Parkes dated February 29, 1796. Parkes recommends a Mr. Harrison Almand, a wealthy gentleman from Virginia who is interested in settling in the Territory of the United States South of the Ohio River.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

keywords.term: Territory of the United States, South of the River Ohio

div.p: Although it is long since I had the pleasure of seeing or addressing you yet I am emboldened from our former acquaintance to recommend to your civilities & attention Mr. Harrison Almand a Gentleman of my acquaintance from Virginia who has determined to visit your Country with a view to a purchase & settlement. he is wealthy & respectable & will become a worthy member of your Society. be pleased to excuse this freedom & believe me with much respect & esteem

closer.salute: Your Most ob Sert obedient servant

address.addrLine:
His Excellency William Blount
esq. esquire
Governor of the Territory of the U.S. S. United States South of the River Ohio
